title: Customer Store
subtitle: Access the best learning offers for today's products and technologies to help you achieve your business objectives.

carousel.title: Welcome to the Nokia Learning Store
carousel.html:
Welcome to the Learning Store, a new application from NokiaEDU designed to help customers find training on Nokia products and solutions. Now you can search for select learning programs by Technology or Professional Domains linked to your particular job role. Click on a course title for a brief description and add it to "My Learning". Access to learning has never been easier!
The Nokia Learning Store is your primary access point for learning and is designed to enable easy access to relevant courseware and other information. Follow these quick and easy steps to get the most from your experience:
  1. Watch the Nokia Learning Store Quick Tour for information on how to navigate the site.
  2. Search the learning collections and select relevant course offerings.
  3. Use the "My Learning" feature to contact a NokiaEDU Global Contact Center Learning Representative who will help provide pricing and registration information for the course(s) of interest to you. You will be directed to the Learning and Development HUB where customers register, launch and manage training.
  4. All Nokia Customers must be registered to the Learning and Development

carousel.title: What is the GET UP to SPEED (GuTS) program?
carousel.html:
Get Up to Speed: An introduction to a highly successful product family, its underlying technology and its application in Enterprises and Industry Segments.
With the emergence of packet-based subsystems, such as SCADA, CCTV, broadband wireless access, etc, the need of a highly scalable, reliable and service-aware data network is required across many different industry and enterprise sectors. At the same time, the support of legacy subsystems and services is still there. IP/MPLS is a proven and standard technology which bridges the legacy and packet world. In addition, it provides the same and even better resiliency and manageability than some traditional technologies which may be at the edge of obsolesce.
For those who are familiar with technologies such as TDM, SDH/SONET or even LAN and classical IP routing, this training program demystifies how IP/MPLS as a technology can satisfy the current needs and pave the way for the future application and network requirements.
• This training program is built with a balanced mix of lecture, demo and hands-on exercise to cover the technology basic, network and service provisioning, as well as network and service management.
• Feels like taking a test drive on IP/MPLS
Who should attend the GuTS program?
Technical Presales and Solution Architects from Telecom System Integrators and EPC companies; Network design engineers, network planners, and operations support engineers from transportation, power utility, oil and gas, mining, public safety, government and defense sectors; Industry consultants.
Where is it organized?
All over the world! We had sessions running in Tokyo, Singapore, Sydney, Melbourne, Kuala Lumpur, Bangkok, Dubai, Antwerp, Sao Paolo, Buenos Aires, Bogota, Phoenix, Plano... and many more to come.CHARGES?
This is a free-of-charge training program provided by Nokia, organized for prospects. Travel, accommodation, meals and allowance shall be bear by the attendees. The number of attendants per company is limited to 2.
To download the 2017 program for EMEA, click here.
To apply or for more about the scheduled sessions in your area: gcc.nokiaedu@nokia.com.

title: Partner Store
subtitle: Learn how Nokia products and technology can help you grow your sales and fulfill your customers' business needs.

carousel.title: We've changed our look!
carousel.html:
To complement the release of the new Nokia Certifications introduced this month, we have refreshed the look and feel of our Partner Learning Store. We hope you find the new Store to be clean and easy to navigate. Here are a few key features we'd like you to notice:
1. New Featured content found in the 3 Info Boxes on the home page, including a link to the 2016 Partner Learning Store - for partners who want to complete any training already underway.
2. New 2017 Certifications -- find them in the left navigation under Job Roles.
We hope that you enjoy the new Learning Store. Please reach out to your Learning Leads at Nokia EDU if you have any questions or need further assistance. Their contact details can be found at the bottom of the Home page (3).

carousel.title: Updated Partner Catalog
carousel.html:
View the updated Partner Catalog on the Partner Portal.

Click here to view PDF document of what's changed in the catalog.

carousel.title: The Learning Store for Partners goes mobile
carousel.html:
Our mobile app is designed to support and enhance your learning endeavors by enabling you with the learning tools you need on any device - iPhone, iPad, Windows phone and Android.
  • Browse the catalog and discover what’s in store
  • Launch specific content directly from the partner store
  • Register for courses and check progress in My PLE
How to Install
Available on iOS, Android and Windows phones. Simply install the Partner Store web app on your device by following the instructions below.

iOS (iPhone and iPad)
  • Launch the Safari browser and navigate to http://tiny.cc/partnerstore
  • Tap the Share button on the browser’s toolbar - that’s the rectangle with an arrow pointing upward (it is on the bar at the bottom of the screen on an iPhone or iPod Touch).
  • Tap the Add to Home Screen icon in the Share menu.
  • You will be prompted to name the shortcut before tapping the Add button. The shortcut can be dragged around and placed anywhere.
Android
  • Launch Chrome for Android and open http://tiny.cc/partnerstore
  • Tap the menu button and tap Add to home screen.
  • You will be able to enter a name for the shortcut and then Chrome will add it to your home screen.
Windows phone
  • Launch IE and open http://tiny.cc/partnerstore
  • Tap the menu button and tap Add to your home screen.

carousel.title: The NRS II Certification Practice Exam
carousel.html: The NRS II Certification Practice Exam is a downloadable PDF document filled with dozens of questions that will test your knowledge and help prepare you for the Nokia NRS II written exams. Practice questions are included for all of the NRS II focus areas - Interior Routing Protocols, IP/MPLS, and Services Architecture. An answer key is included at the end of the document for you to compare your responses.

carousel.title: The SRC Learning Essentials video series
carousel.html:
The SRC Learning Essentials video series is a collection of short, highly informative video training sessions focused on subjects relevant to courses, exams, and certifications in the SRC program. The content for each video is adapted from SRC course material and contains a combination of lecture and router CLI demonstrations.
Two video series are currently available. Preparing for the NRS II Exams is a collection of six videos designed specifically to help individuals prepare for the NRS II certification written and lab exams. The second series, Tips on Network and Service Router Security, is adapted from the four-day course Nokia Network and Service Router Security (TTP30096) and provides an excellent overview of several of the topics covered in the course.

homepage.title: Nokia training programs are designed to ensure our partners are prepared and effective in their jobs and the Partner Learning Store is designed to make it easy for you to find just what you need. We want you to be successful and knowledge is essential to success. Check back often to discover what is new and enhance your skills through training.
